content:
If you're looking for a term to describe a personal and organized storage location that is actively in use, you might consider using the term "personal repository."

The term "personal repository" combines elements of both "stash" and "repository," suggesting a personal storage location that is organized and used actively, but is not necessarily shared with others. Like a stash, a personal repository might be used by an individual to temporarily store changes to a codebase or other project, while they work on a different branch or feature. However, like a repository, a personal repository might also be used to store a complete history of a project, along with all the files and other assets that make it up.

The term "personal repository" is not commonly used in software development, as it is more often associated with academic or research contexts. However, it could be a useful term to describe a personal storage location for any type of project or collection of materials.
